cards.title: Football / The strange and sometimes terrifying world of mascots
cards.rawTitle: The strange and sometimes terrifying world of mascots

item.title: The strange and sometimes terrifying world of football mascots
item.trailText: As Partick Thistle unveil a new mascot designed by the Turner-prize nominated artist David Shrigley, we take a look at some other weird and wonderful mascots from recent times
item.standFirst: As Partick Thistle unveil a new mascot designed by the Turner-prize nominated artist David Shrigley, we take a look at some other weird and wonderful mascots from recent times. You can also take a look at Memory Lane: football mascots, the best photographs from our archives

displayImages.caption: Partick Thistle mascot Kingsley is unveiled at Firhill Stadium. Artist David Shrigley said that his design would ‘intimidate’ the opponents Photograph: Jeff Holmes/PA
displayImages.altText: Partick Thistle mascot Kingsley is unveiled at Firhill Stadium. Artist David Shrigley said that his design would 'intimidate' the opponents
displayImages.cleanCaption: Partick Thistle mascot Kingsley is unveiled at Firhill Stadium. Artist David Shrigley said that his design would ‘intimidate’ the opponents

displayImages.cleanCaption: Kingsley replaced the slightly less intimidating Jaggy MacBee

cards.title: Wimbledon / Djokovic ready to defend title – Becker
cards.rawTitle: Djokovic ready to defend title – Becker

item.title: Novak Djokovic ready to defend Wimbledon title, says coach Boris Becker
item.trailText: Novak Djokovic's coach, Boris Becker, says the current world No1 will not be taking anything for granted when he defends his title in next week's tournament
item.standFirst: Novak Djokovic's coach, Boris Becker, says the current world No1 will not be taking anything for granted when he defends his title in next week's tournament. Becker says last year's performance from Djokovic was spectacular. He also comments on Andy Murray's performance and the challenges of the world famous competition

cards.title: Cricket / Australia are aiming to win the Ashes, says Clarke
cards.rawTitle: Australia are aiming to win the Ashes, says Clarke

item.title: Australia aiming to win Ashes, says Michael Clarke
item.trailText: The Australian High Commission in London welcomes the Australia cricket team to London ahead of the Ashes series beginning next month
item.standFirst: The Australian High Commission in London welcomes the Australia cricket team to London ahead of the Ashes series beginning next month. The Australian high commissioner, Alexander Downer, tells the team they cannot lose to England. Clarke says he is aware of the pressure on his team and says that the team are playing to win

cards.title: Football / Brazil have to make do without Neymar, says manager
cards.rawTitle: Brazil have to make do without Neymar, says manager

item.title: Brazil have to make do without Neymar, says manager
item.trailText: Dunga, the Brazil manager, says his team will have to work around Neymar's suspension for the rest of the Copa América
item.standFirst: Dunga, the Brazil manager, says his team need forward Neymar but that they will have to work around the captain's four-match ban. The manager's comments come after Brazil's 2-1 win against Venezuela on Sunday, which secured their place in the quarter-finals of the Copa América. Neymar received his ban after the defeat to Colombia in their previous match.

cards.title: Golf / Spieth elated after winning 2015 US Open championship
cards.rawTitle: Spieth elated after winning 2015 US Open championship

item.title: Jordan Spieth elated after winning 2015 US Open
item.trailText: Jordan Spieth gives his reaction after winning the 2015 US Open championship at Chambers Bay on Sunday
item.standFirst: Jordan Spieth gives his reaction after winning the 2015 US Open championship at Chambers Bay on Sunday. Spieth says he is still coming to terms with the victory and adds his commiserations for fellow competitor Dustin Johnson. Speith is the youngest player to ever win a US Open tournament at the age of 21

cards.title: Olympic Games / Paris announced its candidacy for the 2024 event
cards.rawTitle: Paris announced its candidacy for the 2024 event

item.title: Paris makes bid for 2024 Olympic Games
item.trailText: Paris announced its candidacy for the 2024 Olympic Games on Tuesday
item.standFirst: Paris announced its candidacy for the 2024 Olympic Games on Tuesday. The French capital will be competing with Boston, Hamburg and Rome for the international sporting event. The mayor, Anne Hidalgo was initially reluctant to back the bid but endorsed the idea in March, joining the City Hall and French president François Hollande to support the Olympic plan

cards.title: In pictures / Stage nine of the Volvo Ocean Race Lorient to Gothenburg
cards.rawTitle: Stage nine of the Volvo Ocean Race Lorient to Gothenburg

item.title: Volvo Ocean Race: stage 9
item.trailText: The best pictures from the ninth and final leg of the 2014-15 Volvo Ocean Race, from Lorient in France to Gothenburg in Sweden, via a 24 hour pit stop in The Hague. The race covers 39,379 nautical miles and visits 11 ports in 11 countries over nine months. The overall winners were Abu Dhabi Ocean Racing, finishing 24 minutes ahead of second-placed Team Brunel.• More of the best images from the Volvo Ocean Race
item.standFirst:
The best pictures from the ninth and final leg of the 2014-15 Volvo Ocean Race, from Lorient in France to Gothenburg in Sweden, via a 24 hour pit stop in The Hague. The race covers 39,379 nautical miles and visits 11 ports in 11 countries over nine months. The overall winners were Abu Dhabi Ocean Racing, finishing 24 minutes ahead of second-placed Team Brunel.

• More of the best images from the Volvo Ocean Race

displayImages.caption: The teams start from Lorient, France Photograph: Ainhoa Sanchez/Volvo Ocean Race via Getty Images
displayImages.credit: Ainhoa Sanchez/Volvo Ocean Race via Getty Images
displayImages.altText: The teams start from Lorient, France
